alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:25AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GUERNSEY... SOUTHEASTERN COSHOCTON...NORTHERN MUSKINGUM AND SOUTHWESTERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 315 AM EDT... At 225 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coshocton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Coshocton, Newcomerstown, West Lafayette, Port Washington, Conesville, Stone Creek, Plainfield, Chili, and Bakersville. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 58 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
